bill.title: Motor vehicle inspection stickers; eliminate.
bill.description: An Act To Amend The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Inspection Law; To Amend Section 63-13-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Rename The Law As The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Safety Law; To Amend Section 63-13-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Corrections To Conform To The Tenor Of The Act; To Amend Section 63-13-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Designate The Motor Vehicle Inspection Department And To Promulgate Rules And Regulations; To Amend Section 63-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Certain Vehicles That Are Subject To Inspection By Other Entities From Safety Inspections Under This Chapter; To Amend Section 63-13-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reference Window Tint Inspections And Inspections Of Vehicles Equipped With A Liquefied Petroleum Or Natural Gas Carburetion System; To Amend Sections 63-13-15, 63-13-21 And 63-13-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 63-7-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Dealing With Window Tint, To Conform; To Amend Section 27-19-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Additional Tag Fee; To Amend Section 37-41-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Section 63-13-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Grace Period For Obtaining A Valid Inspection Sticker; To Repeal Section 63-13-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Licensing Of Official Inspection Stations; To Repeal Section 63-13-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Improper Representation As An Inspection Station; To Repeal Section 63-13-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Inspections By Dealers; And For Related Purposes.
